thread.title: Unlucky Hawk suffers grand final heartache
thread.title_full: Unlucky Hawk suffers grand final heartache

title: Unlucky Hawk suffers grand final heartache
text:
Jack Gunston’s return means grand final heartache for Hawthorn teammate Billy Hartung Adam Baldwin FOX SPORTS Jack Gunston’s return means grand final heartache for Hawthorn teammate Billy Hartung Adam Baldwin FOX SPORTS Josh Gibson: 'We know what we need to do' 1:46 
AFL: Hawthorn defender Josh Gibson says the Hawks have learnt from their loss to West Coast in the first week of the finals, and know what they must do to win this weekend October 1st 2015 6 hours ago /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/AFL/News/ 
IT won’t numb the pain, but Billy Hartung can take solace from the fact that he’s not the first to be dropped from a grand final side and he won’t be the last. 
The second-year midfielder was dumped from the Hawthorn team to make way for Jack Gunston, who has recovered from an ankle injury. 
Hartung could hardly have done more in the sub roles in his two finals appearances, but there was never any question over Gunston’s inclusion if he was fit. 
It was Ryan Schoenmakers who replaced Gunston for the semi-final win over Adelaide and appeared the logical omission all week. 
However, his versatility and set shot kicking ability means he’ll avoid watching a third-straight grand final from the stands. 
Schoenmakers won’t be the only Hawk breathing a sigh of relief, with David Hale’s bacon saved only by Jon Ceglar’s lack of match practice. Other Stories
